div.sent: Asia is the largest continent of the world.
There are many countries in Asia.
Let us read the names of some countries in the following table.
We have learnt about the cultures of India and Myanmar in Class Three.
Now we will learn about the cultures of two other countries - Japan and Malaysia.
Japan is situated in the north-east of Asia.
Japan consists of some small and big islands.
Earthquakes occur frequently here.
At present buildings are being built to withstand the earthquakes.
Japan is a monolingual country.
Japanese is the main language of this country.
It is the official language.
Most of the people of Japan are Buddhist.
Besides Buddhism, some people believe in Shinto religion.
They are sun worshippers.
Rice and fish are the staple foods of Japan.
Tney put their food in a cup and eat it with sticks.
It is one of their characteristics.
The name of the traditional dress of the Japanese is Kimono.
It is a colourful dress.
Ukata is another of their traditional dresses made in imitation of Kimono.
It is relatively an ordinary dress.
Men and women all wear their traditional dress Kimono and Ukata1 on different festivals.
At present the Japanese wear western dresses like tea-shirts, jeans, etc.
The Japanese are very fond of music.
Folk songs are in vogue on different social and religious festivals.
Ondo and Enco are such folk songs.
They present group dance to the accompaniment of Ondo on various occasions.
Bonodori is a famous dance of Japan.
Besides, one kind of mask dance named Kabuki is also presented here.
The Japanese love games and sports.
The traditional games of this country are: judo, karate, kendo, kite flying, etc.
Sumo1 is the national game of Japan.
It is highly popular in Japan.
There are some customs and etiquettes in the social life of the Japanese.
Most of the festivals of this country are based on seasons.
The biggest festival of this country is oshowgatsu or New Year.
This festival lasts for the first three days of the New Year.
During that time all offices remain closed.
People from distant places gather in temples or holy places.
They pray so that the New Year passes well.
Besides, they observe icobana or arranging flowers, and tea festival.
These are symbols of simplicity and beauty.
During this time they present cherry dances.
Autumn is the season of harvesting.
During this time various kinds of cake festivals take place in the rural areas.
This festival is observed on 5th May every year.
The Japanese burn the dead body and bury the ashes.
Malaysia is situated in the southeast of Bangladesh.
It is a very beautiful country.
The people of this country are very hospitable.
Most of the people of Malaysia speak Malay.
Besides, there are Telegu, Malayalam, Punjabi, Hindi, etc.
Most of the inhabitants of Malaysia are Muslims.
But there are also Christians, Hindus, Buddhists and people of other religions.
Rice and fish are the main foods of the Malaysians.
They use a lot of spices in their food.
Their favourite breakfast is Nasilemark.
It is one kind of rice, spicy and perfumed.
With this, there are coconut milk and chicken or beef curry.
It is served on leaves of banana trees.
Besides, they eat Chinese, Indonesian, Indian, and Pakistani food.
Of the fruits, they eat pineapples, bananas, papayas, guavas, mangoes and a fruit called durian.
They call durian the king of fruits.
It looks like a jackfruit of our country.
This fruit has an odour and thorny.
Generally different colourful silky dresses are very much popular with the Malaysians.
Scarf and kaptan are their traditional dresses.
They like very much the clothes with boutique.
They love to wear gold and silver jewellery.
Music and dance are closely related in Malayasia.
There is Sayaputul theatre here.
It comes from Java.
Besides, Chinese operas are worth mentioning.
Most of the musical instruments of this country are made of coconut choir.
Tarian Lilin is a dance with candles.
This is a dance of unmarried girls.
The name of their traditional dance is samajao.
This dance is presented during the festival of harvesting.
The people of Malayasia are fond of games and sports.
Flying kites is their favourite and traditional game.
This game is called oao.
Silat1 is also their favourite game.
It is very much like Japanese'karate'.
They also enjoy fishing in the sea.
Followers of different religions of this country observe different festivals.
The Muslims observe Eid-ul-Fitr and Eid- ul-Azha.
They call .Eid Huri Raia.
The Hindus observe the festival of light Dipabali.
The Christians observe Christmas.
The Mongolians observe Moon Cake1 festival and the Chinese observe Chinese New Year.
We have become familiar with many aspects of the cultures of Japan and Malaysia.
